pros: I enjoy working at MOLA, the staff are supportive, friendly and approachable. Great working environment, they offer great benefits and good salary.

review_title: Good work but salary is lower compared to others
pros: Great people, work environment, life-work balance, good for start your career in heritage
cons: Driving time not paid, problem with overtimes, low salary

pros: You will get paid on time.
cons: There is a complete lack of respect towards employees from higher management. It is made clear employees are not ‘an asset to the team’ but more a replaceable piece of equipment that doesn’t matter if it breaks physically or mentally.

pros: Got offered a permanent contract. Good team.
cons: Unpaid travel time, unless you are the one driving. Difficult working conditions.

pros: Great place with management who care about their work, partners and staff.
cons: None to date that I can identify

pros: Nice location for runners, being along the canal
cons:
Terrible office conditions; cold, old, infestation
Eccentric staff

pros: Great opportunity to work on some interesting projects - and some great people
cons: Funny old place to work - but all archaeological businesses are!

pros: Lots of opportunity to do things differently and communicate about archaeology. Great team spirit on sites.
cons: Can involve a lot of hard work at pinch points

pros: Salary could be a lot worse, colleagues are nice and from many different countries.
cons: 6 mandatory months of probation during which your sick days are not paid; working outside in all weather conditions; first hour of travel to go to field not paid if you are just a passenger; if site is away (maximum 1h of driving) you have very long days of work; it seems to take years to have an opportunity to become supervisor.

review_title: Good people, good opportunities but room to improve
pros: Opportunities for career progression, great connection, good reputation
cons: Upper management not understanding, poor salaries, welfare of workers not always considered.

review_title: Low wage, low morale, avoid it
pros: Good for on site health and safety standards generally
cons: Terrible relationship between upper management and staff, very poor atmosphere and mental health problems are rife amongst staff

pros: Announced having £1.3 million in reserves for just incase things happen
cons: Layed off 10% of the workforce shortly after
